top_comments.comment: It's far far cheaper in india 👀 ..

Just try this "ginger-cardamom coffee" recipe and tell me how it was...
Take a cup of milk, add 1tsp sugar, add 1tsp instant coffee powder, grate a nail sized ginger, pound 1-2 green cardamoms and then boil.
Your coffee is ready.

comments_since_last_sample.body: Watching from Kochi, Kerala neighbour of Idukki

Enemy but healthy 🤣🤣🤣..
Anyone agree with this?
A small cardamom farmer is under the mercy of the local trader and gets only $14-15 per kg. Enquiries at better prices are welcome. Please reply here.
In nepal, i think farmers sell cardamom at  $6-7 dollar per kg.
Actually they are not green but these guys coloured it with green color to sell in the market. A kind of deception.
this scenery is from heaven i think
Do they speak predominantly Tamil in iddukki, Kerala?
Nahh, not that expensive, around 35 bucks here for a kilo
It's far far cheaper in india 👀 ..
i use green cardamom (Elaichi) everyday in tea, its refreshing and add flavor in tea, Funfact we grew cardamom in central India and can be grown in specific place in Katol :)
